name: Mushroom and Spinach Frittata
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk. Season with salt and pepper to taste. In a 10-inch oven-safe skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and are tender. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the frittata is set and golden brown. Slice and serve hot.

name: Pulled Pork Sandwiches
cooking_method: In a slow cooker, combine the pork shoulder, barbecue sauce, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Cook on low for 8-10 hours, or until the pork is fork-tender. Remove the pork from the slow cooker and shred with two forks. Return the shredded pork to the slow cooker and toss with the cooking liquid. Serve the pulled pork on sandwich rolls.

name: Caprese Salad
cooking_method: Arrange the sliced tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese on a serving platter. Sprinkle with the fresh basil leaves. In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Drizzle the dressing over the salad. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Scampi
cooking_method: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water, then drain the spaghetti. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside. Add the white wine to the skillet and bring to a simmer. Add the lemon juice and zest and simmer until slightly reduced. Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce. If the pasta seems dry, add some of the reserved pasta cooking water. Add the shrimp back to the skillet and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

name: Beef Stroganoff
cooking_method: Cook the egg noodles according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the beef and cook until browned. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside. Add the onion and mushrooms to the skillet and cook until softened. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir to combine. Gradually add the beef broth, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens. Return the beef to the skillet and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through. Stir in the sour cream and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the beef stroganoff over the cooked egg noodles.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
cooking_method: Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Grill or cook in a skillet over medium heat until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side. Let the chicken rest for a few minutes, then slice into strips. In a large bowl, toss together the chopped romaine lettuce, Caesar dressing, grated Parmesan cheese, and croutons. Add the sliced chicken and toss to combine. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

name: Spicy Shrimp Linguine
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
cooking_method: Cook the linguine according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the shrimp and cook until pink, about 3 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside. Add the white wine to the skillet and bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Cook until the wine has reduced by half, about 3 minutes. Drain the pasta and add it to the skillet. Toss to coat with the sauce. Add the shrimp, parsley, and Parmesan cheese, and toss again. Serve immediately.

name: Grilled Chicken Salad
cooking_method: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Grill the chicken until cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per side. Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice it into strips. In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, onion, feta cheese, and cherry tomatoes. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and Dijon mustard. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Divide the salad onto plates and top with the sliced chicken.

name: Vegetarian Chili
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
cooking_method: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, bell peppers, and jalapeño pepper. Cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes. Add the canned black beans, kidney beans, corn, diced tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, and paprika. Stir to combine. Bring the chili to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed. Serve hot, topped with shredded cheese, chopped scallions, and a dollop of sour cream, if desired.

name: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: 1 pound beef tenderloin, sliced into thin strips
cooking_method: Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside. Add the onion, garlic, and mushrooms to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir to combine. Pour in the beef broth and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook until the sauce has thickened, about 5-7 minutes. Stir in the sour cream and Dijon mustard. Add the beef back to the skillet and let it simmer in the sauce for a few minutes to heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot over egg noodles or rice.

name: Grilled Salmon with Mango Salsa
cooking_method: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Grill the salmon for 3-4 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Meanwhile, in a bowl, combine the mango, red bell pepper, jalapeño pepper, red onion, cilantro, and lime juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the grilled salmon hot with the mango salsa on top.

name: Roasted Brussel Sprouts
ingredients: 1 pound Brussel sprouts, trimmed and halved
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. In a bowl, toss together the Brussel sprouts, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the mixture out on a baking sheet in a single layer. Roast for 25-30 minutes, or until the Brussel sprouts are tender and browned. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and return to the oven for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot as a side dish.

name: Mushroom Risotto
cooking_method: Heat the olive oil and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and are lightly browned. Add the rice and cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes. Add the wine and cook, stirring constantly, until the liquid is absorbed. Add the broth, 1 cup at a time, stirring constantly and waiting for each cup to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue cooking and stirring until the rice is tender and creamy, about 20-25 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
cooking_method: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the shrimp and cook until pink, about 3-4 minutes per side. Add the lemon juice and parsley and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

name: Spicy Thai Chicken Curry
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
cooking_method: In a large skillet or wok, heat the coconut milk and chicken broth over medium heat. Add the red curry paste, fish sauce, and brown sugar and stir to combine. Add the chicken, bell pepper, and onion and stir to coat in the sauce. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender. Add the snow peas and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot over rice.

name: Pesto Pasta Salad
cooking_method: In a large bowl, whisk together the pesto, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. Add the cooked pasta, bell peppers, red onion, black olives, and feta cheese and toss to coat in the dressing. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve chilled.

name: Baked Salmon with Lemon and Dill
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 400°F. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, and dill. Place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet and brush with the marinade. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Serve hot.

name: Vegetable Fried Rice
cooking_method: In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the carrots and bell pepper and cook until the vegetables are tender. Add the frozen peas and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes. Push the vegetables to the side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the other side. Scramble the eggs until cooked through and then mix with the vegetables. Add the cooked rice and soy sauce and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
